topic.title: An alternative method for describing columns

keywords.keyword: An alternative method for describing columns

para.text: An alternative method for describing columns
So far, we have been using the database cataloguing features of a
to obtain the descriptions of various columns for use with the #
message when configuring the parameter slots. It is also possible to do this in a simpler way, providing you don't mind executing a
statement to obtain the array of
specifications. Using the previous example of inserting a row into the
table, let us see how this might be done:
ps := c prepare: 'insert into Suppliers (CompanyName, HomePage) values (?, ?)'.
ps paramCols: (c query: 'select CompanyName, HomePage from Suppliers) describeCols.
As you can see, this is somewhat more straightforward than the previous method, especially in cases where you are describing the columns for a prepared statement which requires many parameters.
